choices.D: The formula compares each Time series to the default Time series.
choices.B: The formula returns the Breakdown score as a percentage of the overall score.
choices.A: The formula compares the current score to the previous score.

questions.question_text:
Consider the example formula below. What is the formula output when a Breakdown is applied?

[[Number of new incidents]] / {{Number of new incidents}} * 100;

discussion.content:
The correct answer, given the intended use of square brackets for indicators and assuming the curly braces were a typographical error and should also be square brackets, is:

B. The formula returns the Breakdown score as a percentage of the overall score.

When a breakdown is applied to a formula indicator like this, it computes the score for each breakdown element as a percentage of the total number of new incidents. If the curly braces were meant to represent a constant or a manually set number, the formula would not be syntactically correct, but given the context, it seems they are intended to be square brackets, which would indicate a reference to an indicator.

Selected Answer: D
It's not C. Per documentation, "Formula indicator scores are calculated when a user views the indicator on a dashboard or in KPI Details or the Analytics Hub."

Selected Answer: C
Per product documentation it's c

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D - the code in the Formula box is JavaScript.

A true statement about a Formula Indicator is:

C. The Formula Indicator score is calculated at collection time.

Formula Indicators in ServiceNow Performance Analytics are evaluated and their scores are calculated when the data collection job runs. This is unlike real-time calculations, which would occur when data is viewed or interacted with. The scores are based on the data available at the time of collection, according to the defined formula.

choices.B: The Formula Indicator uses a Performance Analytics Script.
choices.A: Any formula errors are reported in the Formula Error log.
choices.C: The Formula Indicator score is calculated at collection time.
choices.D: The code in the Formula box is JavaScript.

questions.question_text: Which is a true statement about a Formula Indicator?

choices.C: The filter you create in the Now Experience UI Builder is available in all workspaces.
choices.B: For filters to work in workspaces, you must configure an event handler to apply the filters.
choices.A: Only users with the admin role can create User Experience filters.
choices.D: A single filter can be used across all visualisations in a workspace.

discussion.content:
A. Only users with the admin role can create User Experience filters.
B. For filters to work in workspaces, you must configure an event handler to apply the filters.
D. A single filter can be used across all visualisations in a workspace.

As it follows uppon documentation(https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-platform-user-interface/page/administer/workspace/task/create-user-exp-filters.html), the filter you create is available in the workspace in which you created it, which makes the option C. The filter you create in the Now Experience UI Builder is available in all workspaces. incorrect.

comments.content: I agree with this. You have to be Admin role to create User Experience Filters

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABD
ABD are correct. C is wrong. The filter will only be available in the workspace it was created

The statements true about creating User Experience filters are:

B. For filters to work in workspaces, you must configure an event handler to apply the filters.
C. The filter you create in the Now Experience UI Builder is available in all workspaces.
D. A single filter can be used across all visualizations in a workspace .

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements are true about creating User Experience filters? (Choose three.)

choices.D: Number of incidents with no assignment group
choices.C: Number of incidents not updated in the last 5 days

questions.question_text: Which of these Indicators should NOT be included in a Historical Collection? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Number of new incidents
Number of open incidents not updated in last 5 days
These 2 indicators exist in my PDI and have a historical job associated to them.
So the correct answer is AD

Selected Answer: CD
A - Age is just a number and can therefore be added and calulated from Created and Opened fields as per course materials PA Fundamentals - Data Collection
B - Just a number of tickets, no associated breakdowns
C* - Update within 5d intervals would definitely be obscured in a long term time frame
D* - Risk of re-assignments in a long term time frame

The indicators that should NOT be included in a Historical Collection are those whose values are likely to change based on the current date or other variables that are not fixed in time. Based on the options provided:

A. Average age of open incidents - This indicator's value is dependent on the current date and will change as time progresses, making historical collection inaccurate.

C. Number of incidents not updated in the last 5 days - This is a time-sensitive indicator where the set of incidents meeting this criterion will vary from day to day.

Both of these indicators rely on a dynamic condition that changes daily, which means their historical data would not be accurate if collected at a later date.

questions.question_text: Which of the following measurements can be obtained using Reporting? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Reporting in ServiceNow is used to capture and display data that reflects current or historical states and trends, but it doesn't include predictive analytics features like forecasting. Based on the options provided:

A. Weekly comparison of Incident resolution time vs SLA met percentage - Reporting can be used to compare different metrics such as resolution time and SLA met percentage for a defined time period like a week.

C. Currently Active Incidents with Open Problems - Reporting can show the current state of data, such as active incidents that have associated open problems.

Options B (forecasting) and E (tracking over time) are typically functions of Performance Analytics, which has capabilities for forecasting and time series analysis. Option D (Current view of Employees by Department) is also obtainable through reporting, but it's not a measurement, rather a current state view.

choices.D: Current view of Employees by Department
choices.C: Currently Active Incidents with Open Problems
choices.B: Forecast of HR Case Resolution Times over the Next Month
choices.A: Weekly comparison of Incident resolution time vs SLA met percentage
